comment: In a Moore system, the closure operator is said to have the _exchange property_ if, for all elements ` y ` and ` z ` of the base set and subsets ` S ` of the base set such that ` z ` is in the closure of ` ( S u. { y } ) ` but not in the closure of ` S ` , ` y ` is in the closure of ` ( S u. { z } ) ` (Definition 3.1.9 in [FaureFrolicher] p. 57 to 58.) This theorem allows us to construct substitution instances of this definition. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
